examples: the lantern hung from the roof.
definition: a lamp in a clear case, often a metal case with glass sides, and often with a handle, so that you can carry it outside.

examples: she set up her easel in the park to paint a beautiful landscape.
definition: a wooden frame to hold a picture while it is being painted

examples: the eiffel tower is one of the most famous tourist attractions in paris
definition: an interesting or lively place to go or thing to do.

examples: a six carat diamond.
the lights shone like diamonds.
definition: a clear precious stone of pure carbon, the hardest substance known. diamonds are used in jewellery and also in industry, especially for cutting glass.

examples: I had a really weird dream last night.
definition: a series of images, events and feelings that happen in your mind while you are asleep.

examples: by becoming a blood donor you will be making a vital gift of life to someone else.
definition: a thing that you give to somebody, especially on a special occasion or to say thank you

examples: the firework spluttered and went out.
definition: a small device containing powder that burns or explodes and produces bright coloured lights and loud noises, used especially at celebrations.

examples: the graceful swan glided across the serene lake, leaving ripples in its wake.
definition: a large bird that is usually white and has a long, thin neck. swans live on or near water.

examples: the vibrant pink flamingo stood gracefully in the shallow waters of the wetland, its long legs reflecting in the sunlight.
definition: a large pink bird with long thin legs and a long neck, that lives near water in warm countries.

examples: the little girl presented the princess with a large bouquet of flowers.
definition: a bunch of flowers arranged in an attractive way so that it can be carried in a ceremony or presented as a gift.

examples: most of her paintings were done in watercolours.
definition: paints that you mix with water, not oil, and use for painting pictures.

examples: pre-christian sacred geometry was incorporated into church architecture.
definition: the branch of mathematics that deals with the measurements and relationships of lines, angles, surfaces and solids.

examples: lace curtains.
a tablecloth edged with lace.
definition: a very thin material made from threads of cotton, silk, etc. that are made into a pattern with holes

examples: astronomers were excited to observe the comet as it streaked across the night sky, leaving a brilliant trail of light behind it.
definition: a mass of ice and dust that moves around the sun and looks like a bright star with a tail.

examples: his arms swung as he walked.
a set of keys swung from her belt.
definition: to move backwards or forwards or from side to side while hanging from a fixed point; to make something do this.

examples: in the arid desert, you can find various types of cacti, each adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions.
definition: a plant that grows in hot dry regions, especially one with thick stems covered in spines but without leaves. there are many different types of cactus.

examples: she spent hours perfecting her origami skills, folding colorful paper into intricate shapes like cranes and butterflies.
definition: the japanese art of folding paper into attractive shapes

examples: follow the path through the woods.
definition: a way or track that is built or is made by the action of people walking.

examples: the young girl believed in the magical world of unicorns and often dreamed of riding one through enchanted forests.
definition: an animal like a white horse with a long straight horn on its head.

examples: bright blue dragonflies hovered and darted in the reeds.
definition: an insect with a long, thin body, often brightly coloured, and two pairs of large transparent wings. dragonflies are often seen over water.

examples: the woods and fields that are typical features of the English landscape.
definition: everything you can see when you look across a large area of land, especially in the country.

examples: wheat flour.
definition: a plant grown for its grain that is used to produce the flour for bread, cakes, pasta, etc.; the grain of this plant

examples: she wore a stunning necklace adorned with a deep blue sapphire that sparkled in the sunlight.
definition: a clear, bright blue precious stone

examples: the main bedroom overlooks the garden.
definition: a piece of land next to or around your house where you can grow flowers, fruit, vegetables, etc., usually with a lawn.

examples: my balloon has burst!
definition: a small bag made of very thin rubber that becomes larger and rounder when you fill it with air or gas. balloons are brightly coloured and used as decorations or toys.

examples: all rooms have a balcony or terrace.
definition: a flat, hard area, especially outside a house or restaurant, where you can sit, eat and enjoy the sun

examples: all the colours of the rainbow.
definition: a curved band of different colours that appears in the sky when the sun shines through rain.

examples: the children were delighted to discover a bright red ladybird crawling on a leaf in the garden.
definition: a small flying insect, usually red with black spots.

examples: we lost our way in the labyrinth of streets.
definition: a complicated series of paths, which it is difficult to find your way through

examples: the field was covered in fluffy dandelion seeds, ready to be carried away by the wind.
definition: a small wild plant with a bright yellow flower that becomes a soft white ball of seeds called a dandelion clock.
